alert.note: Alert for Laurens; York (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 27 at 8:52PM EST until further notice by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT EST TONIGHT... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of upstate South Carolina, including the following counties, Chester, Laurens, Union SC and York. * WHEN...Until midnight EST tonight. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Dangerous flows over low-water crossings. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 848 PM EST, Very heavy rain has fallen across the advisory area over the past hour. Strong storms with high rainfall rates will continue to train over the area and small streams will reach bankfull or flood. Urban flooding is also likely in poor drainage areas. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Rock Hill, York, Chester, Fort Mill, Tega Cay, Newport, Lesslie, Monarch Mill, Lockhart, Sharon, Carlisle, Mcconnells, Lowrys, Chester State Park, Rose Hill State Park, Lake Wylie, Bullock Creek, Leeds and Santuc. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: When it is safe to do so, please report flooding or landslides threatening roads or property to the National Weather Service Greenville-Spartanburg by calling toll free, 1, 800, 2 6 7, 8 1 0 1, by posting on our Facebook page, or via Twitter using hashtag NWSGSP. Your message should describe the specific location where impacts occurred and the depth of flooding observed. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
